newsitem.title: USA: Ucyclyd says FDA approves Buphenyl distribution. [CORRECTED]
newsitem.headline: Ucyclyd says FDA approves Buphenyl distribution. [CORRECTED]

text.p: Ucyclyd Pharma Inc said on Tuesday the U.S. Food and Drug Administration recently gave it approval to distribute sodium phenylbutyrate, a drug used to treat urea cycle disorders.
(Corrects spelling of company name from Ocyclyd Pharma Inc. Inserts "urea" to give correct name of disorder).

The drug, which was marketed under the trade name Buphenyl, was manufactured by Maryland-based Pharmaceutics International Inc and was shipped commercially starting September 3, Ocyclyd said in a statement.
Urea cycle disorders affected about 400 patients around the world.
The company was not immediately available for further comment.
